intro: Parosela chrysorrhiza, commonly known as the golden root or yellow parosela, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is known for its aromatic roots, which have been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
